title: 6. IRRI Agronomy Challenge: Rat and Bird Control (13 January 2012)

tasks.task: Managing Rat Infestation in a Rice Field
subtasks: Observing the evenness and potential rat-caused damage of a recently seeded field
Considering the role of rats in creating uneven field conditions
Exploring strategies for rat control, including the use of trap crops
Understanding the optimal timing for rat management based on reproduction rates
Identifying potential rat habitats on the farm, such as irrigation canal entrances
Demonstrating how rats navigate traps, considering their physical limitations
Assessing the potential impact of birds on the seeded rice and exploring deterrent methods

tasks.task: Evaluating Bird Deterrent Techniques for Rice Crop
subtasks: Considering the use of flags for visual disturbance to deter birds
Investigating the use of noise deterrents, such as windmills, to keep birds away

tasks.task: Assessing Field Drainage and Soil Conditions
subtasks: Noting the impact of recent thawing on field conditions
Evaluating the presence of standing water or puddles in the field
Considering the benefits of proper drainage for crop health

tasks.task: Analyzing Pest Control Methods for Rice Plantation
subtasks: Weighing the pros and cons of using trap crops for rat control
Evaluating the effectiveness of noise deterrents in bird control
Considering alternative pest control methods beyond physical barriers and traps

tasks.task: Examining the Integration of Irrigation Systems with Pest Management
subtasks: Noting the proximity of irrigation canals to the field
Considering the potential for pests to rely on irrigation infrastructure
Assessing the need for regular maintenance of irrigation systems to prevent pest habitats
